roleset.name: have a strong stance

roles.note: Very, very often occurs in light verb constructions.

roleset.note: Added by Julia based on noun corpus examples. No corresponding VNcls.

example.name: light verb!
example.text: ... is one of the cabinet ministers who-1 *trace*-1 take the clearest stand against nuclear power .

example.name: all args
example.text: Chinese lawmakers said the two can only return if they `` abandon their antagonistic stand against the Chinese government
example.note: 'antagonistic' is perhaps a borderline arg1 here, as it is very adjectival. However, it sums up the nature of the stance towards the Chinese gov't far more than most other adjectival modifiers would, so I felt comfortable calling it arg1. Use your best judgment.

example.name: weird tree
example.text: the Republicans are seen drawing support for their `` Germans First '' stand on social - welfare issues .
example.note: this tree is a little off-- "on social-welfare issues" should be part of the NP, but it isn't. Of course, don't tag anything outside the span-- but normally, it would make a good arg2.
